title: lost sent emails
creator: wildeyes
content:
I just sent an email and had to go back to it to check something (which I do a lot) and it does not show on my sent list. I can find it doing a search for it and I see it (and 3 others) under search and it says it is in sent file, but actually none of the 4 emails on this search now can be found in the sent folder. And they all did (but the one from tonight) 2 days ago.

I now wonder if other emails have been lost, and can be accessed only by doing a search. But I need to have the emails in the serch folder as I go back to many of them a lot and all the time. Now I will not be able to find them unless I can remember who i sent it to. And I wonder how many more of them are lost and I just have no idea.

Any ideas? Has there been an update in the last week??

What can I do to get these emails (and maybe many others) back?

And I just copied this message to save and put it in an email to myself and sent it and it is not there.

Nancy
metadata: ;category:other;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/123.0.0.0 Safari/537.36;product:thunderbird

title: Thunderbird is very slow if it has not been used for a long time.
creator: scoopex
content:
I use Thunderbird on several computers and my IMAP account contains several hundred thousand emails.

In everyday use on my main computer this works very well and I have no problems with the speed of Thunderbird. If I open Thunderbird on a computer that I only use every 2-3 weeks, it becomes a real test of patience.

Thunderbird updates, indexes and compresses about 50 folders in the background.

As a result, Thunderbird is hardly usable for about 30 minutes. For example, if you want to write a new email (the most common case), the mail editor is extremely slow to use - characters entered only appear with a delay of 10-30 seconds, even though the computer is already very powerful with an SSD and a fast CPU.

Is there a configuration option to run the mailbox update with such a low priority or to assign a high priority to the Mail Editor?
metadata: ;category:fix-problems;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Ubuntu; Linux x86_64; rv:123.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/123.0;product:thunderbird

title: Tried several times to install Thunderbird, no succes
creator: roossn
content: Tried to install Thunderbird, after installing see by surprise that my 30 years old emailadres (simonroos@zeepost.nl) is already registered and that Thunderbird is trying to make contact with it, tried to delete it, without succes, that was yesterday. Today I deleted all, installed Thunderbird again, using my main gmail address and when it did not work also another gmail address and get same warning: Login to server not possible, probably wrong configuration, wrong username or password. Checking and checking again, no errors found. Thank you! Best regards, Simon Roos

title: Autenticazione non riuscita col server di posta in uscita SMTP
creator: annamaria.gremmo
content:
Buongiorno, da oggi non riesco più ad inviare e-mail dal mio pc, via Thunderbird versione 115.9.0 (32 bit), tramite il mio account di posta elettronica Hotmail.it. Visualizzo come da immagini allegate un invito a reinserire la password, e quindi un messaggio di errore che comunica l'impossibilità di raggiungere il server SMTP. Il metodo di autenticazione, le impostazioni account (sia IMAP che SMTP) sono corrette e non le ho mai cambiate. Da notare che, via browser, la posta funziona invece normalmente, così come nella versione mobile. Il problema si presenta solo lato PC con Thunderbird. E' possibile che ci siano problemi con il server SMTP di Thunderbird?

Vi ringrazio per il vostro aiuto, Annamaria
metadata: ;category:other;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/123.0.0.0 Safari/537.36;product:thunderbird

title: Setting default columns in message list view
creator: RichardWattCoventry
content:
I am trying to find out how to set the default columns list for my Thunderbird Supernova (115.9.0) installation on Windows 7 Home 64-bit with SP1 - I've followed the instructions in [article] this article, but I'm encountering the following issue:

If I have a folder called (say) "Jo Bloggs" that already has the columns list set that I require and I add a new subfolder (say) "2023", this new subfolder has the application default columns list showing and not the columns list from the parent folder.

Is there any way that I can configure the columns list used by Thunderbird so that all new folders use the same columns list as their parent folder?

title: Second E-Mail Account
creator: jem630
content:
I'm having a lot of trouble setting up a functioning second e-mail account in Thunderbird. I've tried numerous times and it either doesn't show up or if it does, it won't receive or send. I wonder if part of the problem is the settings provided by my ISP. Thunderbird fills them in automatically, but they're not the ones my ISP wants. Both the server name and the ports are incorrect. I try to change them manually but then the 'continue' button is greyed out and I'm stuck. Using the ones Thunderbird wants doesn't work, I can't send or receive. I need it to be a POP3 account, my ISP gives us very limited server space.

When I set up my initial e-mail account the automatic settings were correct to what my ISP wanted, so there wasn't a problem. Any help would be appreciated.
metadata: ;category:other;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:109.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/119.0;product:thunderbird

title: Thunderbird Calendar event notification crashes Thunderbird
creator: vbaccounts
content:
I'm having this same issue on Ubuntu 22.04 and Fedora 39. Similar to archived post Thunderbord Calendar event notification failure to dismiss Calendar notification box doesn't respond to any clicks to close, dismiss, or snooze. This notification comes up about 5 seconds after opening Thunderbird. Clicking the modal opens crash dialog "Application "thunderbird" is not responding You tried to close window "1 Reminder" from application "thunderbird" (Process ID: 72811) but the application is not responding. Do you want to terminate this application? Warning: Terminating the application will close all of its child windows. Any unsaved data will be lost."

The archived post above suggests "disable or remove the add-on, then add the calendar from File/New/Calendar...On the Network..."

1. I used this method when adding my calendar. No add-ins are involved. 2. I only have about 5 seconds between opening Thunderbird and the notification locking it up. Very limited options for any workarounds. 3. Notification has already been dismissed within Nextcloud Calendar but still comes up in Thunderbird. 4. This is a Nextcloud based caldav account.
metadata: ;category:fix-problems;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/123.0.0.0 Safari/537.36;product:thunderbird

title: Thunderbird Issue Resolved
creator: deborahfrancisco1990
content: I posted a question, but when I logged back in, I could not see my post. A man named Dave replied to my question. But it turned out not to be a Thunderbird issue at all. It was an AOL connectivity issue (they host my Verizon email). So no problem!

title: Unable to move messages into some subfolders
creator: andymason1
content:
I am unable to drag and drop messages from Inbox into a number of subfolders in a created folder. Other subfolders in this folder do not have this problem. When I attempt the drag and drop, a circle with slash image appears.

When I attempt to move messages to these problem subfolders using 'right click' and 'move to', the problem subfolders do not appear in the drop down list. Same happens if I use 'message' and 'move to'.

Probably related to this, the font of the problem subfolders recently changed to italic.

I can access the existing messages in the problem subfolders.

I have tried 'repair' on these subfolders, with no change.

I am using Windows 11, Thunderbird 115.9.0.
